NAME: a[[:digit:]+]\[.*\]
MEANING: the arguments to the execve syscall

NAME: acl
MEANING: access mode of resource assigned to vm

NAME: addr
MEANING: the remote address that the user is connecting from

NAME: argc
MEANING: the number of arguments to an execve syscall

NAME: bus
MEANING: name of subsystem bus a vm resource belongs to

NAME: entries
MEANING: number of entries in the netfilter table

NAME: hook
MEANING: netfilter hook that packet came from

NAME: hostname
MEANING: the hostname that the user is connecting from

NAME: id
EXCEPTION: the user ID of the account

NAME: img-ctx
MEANING: the vm's disk image context string

NAME: inode_gid
MEANING: group ID of the inode's owner

NAME: inode_uid
MEANING: user ID of the inode's owner

NAME: ioctlcmd
MEANING: The request argument to the ioctl syscall

NAME: items
MEANING: the number of path records in the event

NAME: key
MEANING: key assigned from triggered audit rule

NAME: kind
MEANING: server or client in crypto operation

NAME: list
MEANING: the audit system's filter list number

NAME: model
MEANING: security model being used for virt

NAME: msg
MEANING: the payload of the audit record

NAME: nargs
MEANING: the number of arguments to a socket call

NAME: nametype
MEANING: kind of file operation being referenced

NAME: new-chardev
MEANING: new character device being assigned to vm

NAME: new-fs
MEANING: file system being added to vm

NAME: new-log_passwd
MEANING: new value for TTY password logging

NAME: new-mem
MEANING: new amount of memory in KB

NAME: new-net
MEANING: MAC address being assigned to vm

NAME: new-rng
MEANING: device name of rng being added from a vm

NAME: old-chardev
MEANING: present character device assigned to vm

NAME: old-fs
MEANING: file system being removed from vm

NAME: old-log_passwd
MEANING: present value for TTY password logging

NAME: old-mem
MEANING: present amount of memory in KB

NAME: old-net
MEANING: present MAC address assigned to vm

NAME: old-rng
MEANING: device name of rng being removed from a vm

NAME: op
MEANING: the operation being performed that is audited

NAME: parent
MEANING: the inode number of the parent file

NAME: perm_mask
MEANING: file permission mask that triggered a watch event

NAME: proctitle
MEANING: process title and command line parameters

NAME: reason
MEANING: text string denoting a reason for the action

NAME: selected-context
MEANING: new MAC context assigned to session

NAME: success
MEANING: whether the syscall was successful or not

NAME: syscall
MEANING: syscall number in effect when the event occurred

NAME: tcontext
MEANING: the target's or object's context string

NAME: terminal
MEANING: terminal name the user is running programs on

NAME: tty
MEANING: tty udevice the user is running programs on

NAME: val
MEANING: generic value associated with the operation

NAME: watch
MEANING: file name in a watch record
